## Description {#details}

Replaces repeated sequences of instructions with function calls.

This works by placing every instruction from every basic block in a suffix tree, and repeatedly querying that tree for repeated sequences of instructions. If a sequence of instructions appears often, then it ought to be beneficial to pull out into a function.

The <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner">MachineOutliner</a> communicates with a given target using hooks defined in <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/targetinstrinfo-h">TargetInstrInfo.h</a>. The target supplies the outliner with information on how a specific sequence of instructions should be outlined. This information is used to deduce the number of instructions necessary to


<ul>
<li>Create an outlined function</li>
<li>Call that outlined function</li>
</ul>


Targets must implement
<ul>
<li>getOutliningCandidateInfo</li>
<li>buildOutlinedFrame</li>
<li>insertOutlinedCall</li>
<li>isFunctionSafeToOutlineFrom</li>
</ul>


in order to make use of the <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner">MachineOutliner</a>.

This was originally presented at the 2016 LLVM Developers&#39; Meeting in the talk &quot;Reducing Code Size Using Outlining&quot;. For a high-level overview of how this pass works, the talk is available on YouTube at

<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yorld-WSOeU">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yorld-WSOeU</a>

The slides for the talk are available at

<a href="http://www.llvm.org/devmtg/2016-11/Slides/Paquette-Outliner.pdf">http://www.llvm.org/devmtg/2016-11/Slides/Paquette-Outliner.pdf</a>

The talk provides an overview of how the outliner finds candidates and ultimately outlines them. It describes how the main data structure for this pass, the suffix tree, is queried and purged for candidates. It also gives a simplified suffix tree construction algorithm for suffix trees based off of the algorithm actually used here, Ukkonen&#39;s algorithm.

For the original RFC for this pass, please see

<a href="http://lists.llvm.org/pipermail/llvm-dev/2016-August/104170.html">http://lists.llvm.org/pipermail/llvm-dev/2016-August/104170.html</a>

For more information on the suffix tree data structure, please see <a href="https://www.cs.helsinki.fi/u/ukkonen/SuffixT1withFigs.pdf">https://www.cs.helsinki.fi/u/ukkonen/SuffixT1withFigs.pdf</a>

### OutlinerReruns {#ad5066198a91aa174b4ed26be49e1c69c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>cl::opt&lt; unsigned &gt; OutlinerReruns(&quot;machine-outliner-reruns&quot;, cl::init(0), cl::Hidden, cl::desc( &quot;Number of times to rerun the outliner after the initial outline&quot;))</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Number of times to re-run the outliner.

This is not the total number of runs as the outliner will run at least one time. The default value is set to 0, meaning the outliner will run one time and rerun zero times after that.

Definition at line <a href="#l00121">121</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoutliner-cpp">MachineOutliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Replaces repeated sequences of instructions with function calls.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This works by placing every instruction from every basic block in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// suffix tree, and repeatedly querying that tree for repeated sequences of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions. If a sequence of instructions appears often, then it ought</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to be beneficial to pull out into a function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The MachineOutliner communicates with a given target using hooks defined in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TargetInstrInfo.h. The target supplies the outliner with information on how</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a specific sequence of instructions should be outlined. This information</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is used to deduce the number of instructions necessary to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42; Create an outlined function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42; Call that outlined function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Targets must implement</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; getOutliningCandidateInfo</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; buildOutlinedFrame</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; insertOutlinedCall</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; isFunctionSafeToOutlineFrom</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in order to make use of the MachineOutliner.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This was originally presented at the 2016 LLVM Developers&#39; Meeting in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// talk &quot;Reducing Code Size Using Outlining&quot;. For a high-level overview of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// how this pass works, the talk is available on YouTube at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yorld-WSOeU</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The slides for the talk are available at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// http://www.llvm.org/devmtg/2016-11/Slides/Paquette-Outliner.pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The talk provides an overview of how the outliner finds candidates and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ultimately outlines them. It describes how the main data structure for this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pass, the suffix tree, is queried and purged for candidates. It also gives</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a simplified suffix tree construction algorithm for suffix trees based off</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the algorithm actually used here, Ukkonen&#39;s algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For the original RFC for this pass, please see</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// http://lists.llvm.org/pipermail/llvm-dev/2016-August/104170.html</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For more information on the suffix tree data structure, please see</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// https://www.cs.helsinki.fi/u/ukkonen/SuffixT1withFigs.pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoutliner-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineOutliner.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An interprocedural pass which finds repeated sequences of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions and replaces them with calls to functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each instruction is mapped to an unsigned integer and placed in a string.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The resulting mapping is then placed in a \\p SuffixTree. The \\p SuffixTree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is then repeatedly queried for repeated sequences of instructions. Each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// non-overlapping repeated sequence is then placed in its own</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p MachineFunction and each instance is then replaced with a call to that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner/#a8390acb69c9afa4044e5d8f3ffec7d12">MachineOutliner</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulepass/#a723659a08d210f4f566887bda3f9f976">ModulePass</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner/#ae1fca7d10d37a4c6d1e3261e727f5186"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner/#ae1fca7d10d37a4c6d1e3261e727f5186">ID</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The mode of the outliner.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When is&#39;s CGDataMode::None, candidates are populated with the suffix tree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// within a module and outlined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When it&#39;s CGDataMode::Write, in addition to CGDataMode::None, the hash</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sequences of outlined functions are published into LocalHashTree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When it&#39;s CGDataMode::Read, candidates are populated with the global</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// outlined hash tree that has been built by the previous codegen.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Find all repeated substrings that satisfy the outlining cost model by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// constructing a suffix tree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If a substring appears at least twice, then it must be represented by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// an internal node which appears in at least two suffixes. Each suffix</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is represented by a leaf node. To do this, we visit each internal node</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// in the tree, using the leaf children of each internal node. If an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// internal node represents a beneficial substring, then we use each of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// its leaf children to find the locations of its substring.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Mapper Contains outlining mapping information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param&#91;out&#93; FunctionList Filled with a list of \\p OutlinedFunctions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each type of candidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/machineoutliner/#a9ffe567aa54e3a2cf09da0fda0b7782b">findCandidates</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-machineoutliner-cpp-/instructionmapper">InstructionMapper</a> &amp;Mapper,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">                 std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;OutlinedFunction&gt;&gt; &amp;FunctionList);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Sort the start indices so that we can efficiently check if candidates</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// overlap with the ones we&#39;ve already found for this sequence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a74cdbd1e4f731e7d7cd83461b8b1de0b">llvm::sort</a>(RS.StartIndices);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;StartIdx : RS.StartIndices) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Trick: Discard some candidates that would be incompatible with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ones we&#39;ve already found for this sequence. This will save us some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// work in candidate selection.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If two candidates overlap, then we can&#39;t outline them both. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// happens when we have candidates that look like, say</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// AA (where each &quot;A&quot; is an instruction).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We might have some portion of the module that looks like this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// AAAAAA (6 A&#39;s)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In this case, there are 5 different copies of &quot;AA&quot; in this range, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// at most 3 can be outlined. If only outlining 3 of these is going to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be unbeneficial, then we ought to not bother.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that two things DON&#39;T overlap when they look like this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// start1...end1 .... start2...end2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// That is, one must either</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; End before the other starts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; Start after the other ends</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EndIdx = StartIdx + StringLen - 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="791"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!CandidatesForRepeatedSeq.empty() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><span class="doxyHighlight">          StartIdx &lt;= CandidatesForRepeatedSeq.back().getEndIdx()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><span class="doxyHighlight">        ++NumDiscarded;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;    .. DISCARD candidate @ &#91;&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; StartIdx &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          &lt;&lt; EndIdx &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#93;; overlaps with candidate @ &#91;&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          &lt;&lt; CandidatesForRepeatedSeq.back().getStartIdx()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; CandidatesForRepeatedSeq.back().getEndIdx()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#93;\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It doesn&#39;t overlap with anything, so we can outline it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Each sequence is over &#91;StartIt, EndIt&#93;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Save the candidate and its location.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlight">      ++NumKept;</span></CodeLine>
